title: (x) Stencil-type font ID using only a sketch - Banco {Dav}
content:
I’m trying to remember the name of this typeface, but I don’t have a sample other than this horrible sketch done from memory. The key is that the G is separated into two parts, and the trapezoid is larger at the top than bottom. The typeface is probably more bold and condensed than my sketch, and less cartoony.

You can see it here: [http://img370.imageshack.us/my.php?image=impossiblefont5om.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20071009125517/http:/img370.imageshack.us/my.php?image=impossiblefont5om.png "http://img370.imageshack.us/my.php?image=impossiblefont5om.png")

 [‹ (x) Mexican Cinema ornate face - Victorian {Lauri}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071009125517/http:/typophile.com/node/16723 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Emerystudio typeface - similar to Foundry Gridnik, Blender {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071009125517/http:/typophile.com/node/16713 "Go to next forum topic")
author: OptimusChyme

comments.content:
This might be a little bit better; people have remarked it looks like Lithos but it’s really not.

[http://img478.imageshack.us/my.php?image=impossiblefont23my.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20071009125517/http:/img478.imageshack.us/my.php?image=impossiblefont23my.png "http://img478.imageshack.us/my.php?image=impossiblefont23my.png")

Found an example of it from the good people at Ask Metafilter:  
 [http://krushskatepark.com/images/bf\_thrasher.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071009125517/http:/krushskatepark.com/images/bf_thrasher.jpg "http://krushskatepark.com/images/bf\_thrasher.jpg")

’THRASHER’ would be ’ [Banco](http://web.archive.org/web/20071009125517/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1129&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=ADT0004879)’, by Roger Excoffon..

Dav
